title: Prediction of the Cu Oxidation State from EELS and XAS Spectra Using Supervised Machine Learning
content: Electron energy loss spectroscopy (EELS) and X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS) provide detailed information about distributions and locations of atoms, their coordination numbers and oxidation states, and the bonding characteristics [1]. However, analysis of XAS/EELS data often relies on matching the spectra of an unknown experimental sample to a series of simulated or experimental spectra of standard samples. This limits analysis throughput and the ability to extract quantitative information from a sample.
